reviewText: I never get tired of this show. Mr. Norris never lets the people down when it comes to action. As I have said before, it's nice to have his show out there showing that not everyone is willing to give in to the bad guys. Bring the other seasons on!!!!!!!
I enjoy watching Walker, Texas Ranger over and over.  It really help me to focus on my job and the problems that I faces day to day at work.  I wish the other seasons and be released all at one time.

These shows are compelling viewing, you cant turn away from them in case you miss something. They are a great tribute to a great man.....and promote public awareness about a lot of issues and alternate lifestyles than those of our own. Wonderful, just wish they would release the other series quicker, we have been waiting a long time for them.

John Candy and Joe Flaherty of Second City TV said it very well..."it blowed up real good". There have always been explosions in this series, but it seems that they increased exponentially by the Third Season. The first episode starts it off with an explosive expert blowing lots of stuff up.

As I took out the last disc I felt melancholy just knowing eventually I'll get to the end of the entire series. I don't want to. I am enjoying the series so much I plan to slow down my watching so I can enjoy them for a longer period of time,

Thank God for TV Land. I will be able to watch reruns once I've watched all my discs up to and including the Final Season. But for now I will savor each "New" episode.

The only off note is what happened to Uncle Ray?

I love Walker, Texas Ranger. It's a fun show that has a heart and some good values. I really like how the show handles complex, emotional issues like abuse, rape and drugs. These are handled without being too preachy.

What's really great is this is a show safe for most kids. Walker is a hero. Kids need solid heroes to show them the difference between right and wrong.

This is my all time fav!  I love the series and had purchased a few and needed this to complete set.

Three seasons of this police drama that ran on CBS from 1993-01, dispensing his own brand of roundhouse-kicking justice have not slowed Texas Ranger Cordell Walker (Chuck Norris). As an appreciative observer remarks at one point during season 3, "You still have all the moves, Walker." Whether going undercover as a cocaine dealer in Miami or "delivering a little pain" against white supremacists, Russian mobsters, street gangs, IRA terrorists, heroin smugglers, or vengeful ex-convicts,

Walker is "a damn one-man army" who "walks the walk and talks the talk." No one delivers Chuck-isms such as, "The bigger they are, the harder they hit" like Norris. Walker,

This 1994-95 Season is a bit edgier than its first 2 seasons with cruder language and more graphic action.

For instance, the episode "The Juggernaut," about a wife beater terrorizing a woman's support group, is particularly rough stuff. In the explosive 3rd Season opener, "Blown Apart," a Bible-quoting mad bomber unleashes a holocaust of fiery destruction that even Walker cannot defuse in time.

Among this 1994-1995 Season's most memorable episodes is "Final Justice," in which Walker discovers that the man who killed his parents when he was a kid is still alive, leading to a most dangerous game in which Walker becomes the prey of this hunt-happy racist (John Vernon).

In the "Deep Cover," episode, Walker partners up with a female cop(Kathy Long), who, as an actress, makes a great world champion kickboxer. "Blackout" opens intriguingly with an amnesiac Walker waking up in a casino office clad in a tuxedo, holding a gun and lying next to a dead body. Chuck Norris commentary would have been a real kick, but then again, he is a man of action, and this season does deliver for Walker fans.

It's also nice to see WALKER TEXAS RANGER complete, uncut, and commercial-free without all those you get on this show on TV Land, WGN, Hallmark, and USA.

The box came in good condition, along with the fourth season.

I had to request the shipment for overseas, but despite the estimated time to be nearly two months, it came much quicker, about two and a half weeks (Just in time, I just finished watching Season 2)

I would recommend the expediter, especially for any overseas shipping,  the shipping costs are universally priced, but I thought they did do a good job in sending it before its estimated due date.

This particular CD collection had Latin Languages included, in case I decide to it in Spanish.

The Rangers always seem to get into tight spots with lots of danger but they always end up on top, defeating the bad guys. There are a couple of episodes with scenes of night-club dancers, etc. that I wish had been left out of the series. For the most part, the episodes are decent and provide for lots of fun entertainment. Chuck Norris as "Walker" shows what he's made of when he takes on his opponents hand-to-hand!

I got this when it was first let out on dvd. I have watched this series from beginning to end. I hated to see it go off the air. I wish they had more shows like it on tv now. This tv show had some great morals in it and talked about a lot of the tough issues that the world is dealing with. It has the morals about right and wrong. I have seen every episode of the show and just about memorized. I recorded them on vhs tapes but have about worn them all out. That is why I have purchased all the seasons on dvd. The picture quality is a lot better than the vhs tapes which made it even more rewarding to get this series on dvd. I have a list of the episodes of this season. The episodes are:

2.)Break In

3.)The Return Of Larue

4.) The Juggernaut

Disc Five

2.) El Coyote Part Two

3.) The Avenger

2.) Deadline

2.) Hall Of Fame

This is all of the episodes that are on season three. I enjoyed them all and have no least favorites. I would highly recommend anyone watching this series and getting it on dvd. I have not regretted a minute purchasing this series on dvd. I am really happy that they finally released all of the seasons on dvd. It is a must buy for any Walker Texas Ranger fans or Chuck Norris Fans. I am also a Chuck Norris fan I also have a lot of his movies on dvd as well. Watch this show for yourself you will not regret it! It is a must buy!

To say I'm a Walker fan would be an incredible understatement.  I watched every episode when they came out, and now I am enjoying them all again on DVD.  How can anyone get enough of seeing Chuck Norris bring justice to criminals, even if only on TV.  There is such a feeling of satisfaction when you see justice served.  Speaking of which, if you've ever had a "What Would Chuck Norris Do?" moment, Chuck now writes weekly on the very issues affecting the day!  What a huge bonus for Chuck Norris fans.  It is obvious that a very large budget was spent on many episodes in Season 3, as the action takes Walker to many remote, hard to film locations.  Now I just have to restrain myself from watching the rest of Walker Season 3 on TV until I can watch the rest on DVD.
